title: Data Scientist
job_description:
Job Description
Join Emerson for a dynamic, collaborative environment where your skills will be tested and your contributions drive business results. As a Senior Data Scientist, you'll blend traditional data science with a focus on engineered products and industrial goods. Innovate and excel in a dynamic organization committed to continuous improvement.
In this Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:
- Drive the development and implementation of data science and AI models and algorithms to improve product development, pricing strategies, and customer experiences.
- Stay abreast of the latest research and industry developments, leading our company's efforts in demonstrating data science and AI techniques.
- Collaborate with multi-functional teams, including data scientists, data engineering, pricing, and business experts, to identify areas where data science and AI can deliver value.
- Partner with pricing program team to maintain, refine, and scale target discount engine logic for downstream quoting systems across product groups and world areas.
- Discover and assess new generative AI technologies that can be implemented to improve the organizations Pricing analytics and metrics.
- Engage and collaborate with third parties and external specialists as required, bringing to bear experience in industrial goods, engineering products, and/or B2B sales to drive data-driven strategies.
- Share findings, insights, and recommendations with collaborators, customers, partners, and team members through presentations, reports, and visualizations.
- Identify, assess, and mitigate corresponding risks with generative AI, ensuring compliance with data privacy and security regulations. 
Who You Are:
You experiment with a wide range of existing technologies while applying new and emerging options that can enhance organizational outcomes. You lay out a thorough schedule and list steps for achieving objectives. You facilitate an open dialogue with a wide variety of contributors and partners.
For This Role, You Will Need:
- +4 years of relevant work experience as a professional Data Scientist.
- A degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Statistics, Applied Math, Physics, Engineering, or a related field is required.
- Expertise in statistics/machine learning (prediction, hypothesis testing, simulation).
- Proficiency with Python, SQL, Django, Sklearn, Pandas, and Docker. 
- Familiarity with Power BI, Tableau, or other Data Analytics/Business Intelligence Tools.
- Fluent English and Spanish. 
Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:
- Master´s degree or equivalent experience is preferred. 
- Azure cloud computing experience a plus.
